a1: @keyframes definisce step animazione CSS. Specifica proprietà CSS a diversi punti (0%, 50%, 100%) dell'animazione.
q2: Quali sono le timing function comuni?
a2: ease (default, lento-veloce-lento), linear (costante), ease-in (accelera), ease-out (decelera), ease-in-out (accelera e decelera).
a3: Sì, usa animation-iteration-count. 1 = una volta, infinite = loop continuo, o numero specifico di ripetizioni.
q4: How do I use the generated CSS?
a4: Copy the output which includes the @keyframes rule and the animation property. Paste the keyframes at the top of your CSS file and add the animation property to your element selector.
q5: Can I set how many times the animation runs?
a5: Yes, choose from infinite (loops forever), or 1, 2, 3, or 5 iterations. Use infinite for continuous effects like loading spinners, or a fixed count for one-time entrance animations.
